article_title: Donald Boudreaux and Liya Palagashvili: The Myth of the Great Wages 'Decoupling'
article_text:
Many pundits, politicians and economists claim that wages have fallen behind productivity gains over the last generation. This "decoupling" explains allegedly stagnant (or in some versions of the story, declining) middle-class incomes and is held out as a crisis of the market economy.

This story, though, is built on an illusion. There is no great decoupling of worker pay from productivity. Nor have workers' incomes...

twitter.description: In The Wall Street Journal, Donald J. Boudreaux and Liya Palagashvili write that there is no disconnect between productivity and worker pay if you use more accurate measures.
twitter.title: Donald Boudreaux and Liya Palagashvili: The Myth of the Great Wages 'Decoupling'

article_metadata.article.origheadline: Donald Boudreaux and Liya Palagashvili: The Myth of the Great Wages ‘Decoupling’

article_summary:
Many pundits, politicians and economists claim that wages have fallen behind productivity gains over the last generation.
Nor have workers' incomes...
There is no great decoupling of worker pay from productivity.
This "decoupling" explains allegedly stagnant (or in some versions of the story, declining) middle-class incomes and is held out as a crisis of the market economy.
This story, though, is built on an illusion.
